page.title: 19BURWASH COMMON
page.content: At Burwash Commom we have a lovely big playing field, there is apparatus to play on, swings, a see-saw and a climbing frame. Each year a fete is organized, there are lots of different stalls down each side of the field. In the pavilion you can buy drinks, cakes and ice-cream. This year Joanna and I, my name is Sarah, ran a jewellery stall with other bits and bobs too.We raised Â£9.00. Buckle's is opposite the playing field, the people keep Peacocks and Pheasants, they grow and sell vegetables, the grounds of the house are very beautiful and a church fete is held here anually. I entered the Fancy-dress Compitition as Peirrot the Clown and my sister Katie entered as a Match-stick Man holding a sign that said, 'No More Strikes'!
